item.title: Decision Making Under Costly Search
item.description: Choice Models 101 Choice models – the theory that studies how individual decision makers (e.g., consumers) make decisions when faced with a collection of alternatives – is of interest to several research disciplines. The canonical choice model is as follows. A single decision-maker chooses one among a collection \(N\) alternatives, indexed by \(i \in [N]\).1 His (consumption) utility from consuming alternative \(i\) is: \[U_i = v_i + \epsilon_i.\]
